intro: Brodiaea subbiflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its bulbs are adapted for survival in arid conditions, allowing it to store water and nutrients. Brodiaea subbiflora is often found in coastal scrub and chaparral habitats.
